SENT.plain: A 22-year-old homosexual man had persistent systemic lymphadenopathy and a three-week history of rapid swelling and induration of his right upper eyelid
Acquired immune deficiency leading to the development of lymphoma was suspected
A biopsy specimen of the mass revealed Burkitt's lymphoma and treatment with systemic chemotherapy and radiation therapy resulted in remission
A significant number of patients with acquired immune deficiency are developing Burkitt's lymphoma
The three separate syndromes of acquired immune deficiency and their associated ophthalmic manifestations are discussed
